trans-unit.source: Target platform on MSDN driver reference pages
trans-unit.target: Target platform on MSDN driver reference pages

trans-unit.source: In the Requirements block at the bottom of MSDN driver reference pages, you'll see an entry called **Target Platform**.
trans-unit.target: In the Requirements block at the bottom of MSDN driver reference pages, you'll see an entry called **Target Platform**.

trans-unit.source: This line lists editions of Windows to which the page applies.
trans-unit.target: This line lists editions of Windows to which the page applies.

trans-unit.source: Here's an example of such an entry:
trans-unit.target: Here's an example of such an entry:

trans-unit.source: Target Platform set to universal in Requirements block
trans-unit.target: Target Platform set to universal in Requirements block

trans-unit.source: The values specified in **Target Platform** map to the values you can use in Visual Studio, in the **Target Platform** property under **Configuration Properties->Driver** .
trans-unit.target: The values specified in **Target Platform** map to the values you can use in Visual Studio, in the **Target Platform** property under **Configuration Properties->Driver** .

trans-unit.source: Here are the values you might see for **Target Platform** on MSDN, and what they mean:
trans-unit.target: Here are the values you might see for **Target Platform** on MSDN, and what they mean:

trans-unit.source: Term
trans-unit.target: Term

trans-unit.source: Description
trans-unit.target: Description

trans-unit.source: Universal
trans-unit.target: Universal

trans-unit.source: A Universal Windows driver can call this device driver interface (DDI).
trans-unit.target: A Universal Windows driver can call this device driver interface (DDI).

trans-unit.source: A Universal Windows driver runs on the following Universal Windows Platform (UWP)-based editions of Windows 10:
trans-unit.target: A Universal Windows driver runs on the following Universal Windows Platform (UWP)-based editions of Windows 10:

trans-unit.source: Windows 10 for desktop editions (Home, Pro, and Enterprise)
trans-unit.target: Windows 10 for desktop editions (Home, Pro, and Enterprise)

trans-unit.source: Windows 10 Mobile
trans-unit.target: Windows 10 Mobile

trans-unit.source: Windows 10 IoT Core
trans-unit.target: Windows 10 IoT Core

trans-unit.source: Windows Server 2016 Technical Preview
trans-unit.target: Windows Server 2016 Technical Preview

trans-unit.source: For more info, see Getting Started with Universal Windows drivers.
trans-unit.target: For more info, see Getting Started with Universal Windows drivers.

trans-unit.source: Desktop
trans-unit.target: Desktop

trans-unit.source: A driver for Windows 10 for desktop editions or Windows Server 2016 Technical Preview can call this DDI.
trans-unit.target: A driver for Windows 10 for desktop editions or Windows Server 2016 Technical Preview can call this DDI.

trans-unit.source: Mobile
trans-unit.target: Mobile

trans-unit.source: A driver for Windows 10 Mobile can call this DDI.
trans-unit.target: A driver for Windows 10 Mobile can call this DDI.
